Sentencas: A novel solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) utilizing partial oxidation of methane (CH4 + 1/2O(2) = CO + 2H(2)) as internal reforming reaction was investigated in the present study.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: Large electric power as well as CO-H-2 mixture with molar ratio of 2 were obtained by applying LaGaO3 perovskite as electrolyte.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: Although the open circuit potential decreased, the maximum power density increased by doping a small amount of Co to the LaGaO3 electrolyte.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: In particular, the increase in the power density at 1073 K was significant.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: Increasing the amount of doped Co monotonically enhanced the hole conduction resulting in a decrease in the open circuit potential and an increase on the amount of leaked oxygen which results in diminished electric power.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: Consequently, it became clear that the optimized composition for this electrolyte was La0.9Sr0.1Ga0.8Mg0.115Co0.085O3 considering the power density and the amount of oxygen leakage.
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes

Sentencas: Although the thickness of electrolyte with the above composition was as thick as 0.5 mm, a maximum power density and yield of synthesis gas were obtained at 242 mW/cm(2) and 16%, respectively at 1073 K. (C) 1998
Titulo: Simultaneous generation of synthesis gas and electric power by internal reforming fuel cells utilizing LaGaO3 based electrolytes
